newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel says it kills Hizbollah guerrilla in Lebanon.
newsitem.headline: Israel says it kills Hizbollah guerrilla in Lebanon.

text.p: Israel said on Friday its forces killed at least one Hizbollah guerrilla during a clash in its south Lebanon occupation zone.

"An Israeli army force on patrol last night on the slopes of Jabal Safi in the eastern sector of the security zone in South Lebanon hit a Hizbollah force, killing at least one terrorist and destroying their vehicle," the army said in a statement.
The statement said no Israeli soldiers were hurt in the incident.

Iranian-backed Hizbollah guerrillas are fighting to oust Israeli troops and their local militia allies from the 15-km (nine mile)-wide occupation zone the Jewish state set up in 1985 after withdrawing the bulk of its 1982 Lebanon invasion force.
Security sources in Lebanon said on Thursday night that one guerrilla was wounded when two Israeli helicopters fired five rockets at suspected Hizbollah targets in south Lebanon.
Hizbollah had said its guerrillas fired machineguns and rocket propelled grenades at Israeli soldiers trying to infiltrate outside the zone.
There was no immediate confirmation of the Hizbollah attack from pro-Israeli militia sources inside the occupation zone.
